pageProps.pageTitle: Create a job - Reality Conversion | iTwin Platform

initialApis.name: shubhamk-rcs-fix-documentation-tests
initialApis.description: Convert mentioned point cloud formats to web-friendly Orbit Point Cloud.

initialApis.name: realityconversion
initialApis.description: Convert mentioned point cloud formats to web-friendly Orbit Point Cloud.

api.name: realityconversion
api.description: Convert mentioned point cloud formats to web-friendly Orbit Point Cloud.

items.name: jobs-create
items.description:
---

Create a new job to convert point cloud formats to web-friendly Orbit Point Cloud or Cesium 3D Point Cloud. The POST request body MUST include type, name, inputs and outputs.
Accepted input formats for conversion are LAS, LAZ, PLY, E57 and ouput formats are OPC and PNTS.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Created

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax).

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-delete
items.description:
---

Delete an unsubmitted job. Job will not be deleted once it is in active state.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Job was successfully deleted.

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found
Job cannot be deleted once it has been submitted.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-patch
items.description:
---

Patch can be used for changing the job state (to active or cancelled), updating job type, inputs , outputs, options or changing cost estimation parameters.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Job was successfully updated.

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax).

headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

schema.title: Options
schema.description: List of optional parameters to create job

processingEngines.description: Number of engines to be used at most, between 0 and your engine limit. If set at 0, RCS will use your engine limit.

merge.description: If true, then all the input files from multiple containers will be merged into one output file. Else output file will be created per input file.

schema.title: Error Response
schema.description: Gives details for an error that occurred while handling the request. Note that clients MUST NOT assume that every failed request will produce an object of this schema, or that all of the properties in the response will be non-null, as the error may have prevented this response from being constructed.
